part_3.name: Rain Dish
part_3.effect: The Pokémon gradually regains HP in rain.

part_3.name: Rattled
part_3.effect: Raises the Speed stat if the Pokémon is hit by a Bug-, Dark-, or Ghost-type move.

part_3.name: Receiver
part_3.effect: The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.

part_3.name: Reckless
part_3.effect: Powers up moves that have recoil damage.

part_3.name: Refrigerate
part_3.effect: Normal-type moves become Ice-type moves and get a power boost.

part_3.name: Regenerator
part_3.effect: Restores a little HP when the Pokémon switches out.

part_3.name: Ripen
part_3.effect: Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.

part_3.name: Rivalry
part_3.effect: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat if it's battling a Pokémon of the same gender.

part_3.name: RKS System
part_3.effect: Changes the Pokémon's type to match the memory disc it holds.

part_3.name: Rock Head
part_3.effect: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

part_3.name: Rocky Payload
part_3.effect: Powers up Rock-type moves.

part_3.name: Rough Skin
part_3.effect: Inflicts damage on the attacker upon contact.

part_3.name: Run Away
part_3.effect: Enables a sure getaway from wild Pokémon.

part_3.name: Sand Force
part_3.effect: Boosts the power of Rock-, Ground-, and Steel-type moves in a sandstorm.

part_3.name: Sand Rush
part_3.effect: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a sandstorm.

part_3.name: Sand Spit
part_3.effect: The Pokémon creates a sandstorm when it's hit by an attack.

part_3.name: Sand Stream
part_3.effect: The Pokémon summons a sandstorm when it enters a battle.

part_3.name: Sand Veil
part_3.effect: Boosts the Pokémon's evasiveness in a sandstorm.

part_3.name: Sap Sipper
part_3.effect: Boosts the Attack stat if hit by a Grass-type move, instead of taking damage.

part_3.name: Schooling
part_3.effect: When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP is low.

part_3.name: Scrappy
part_3.effect: Enables the Pokémon to hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.

part_3.name: Screen Cleaner
part_3.effect: When the Pokémon enters a battle, the effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil are nullified for both opposing and ally Pokémon.

part_3.name: Seed Sower
part_3.effect: Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when the Pokémon is hit by an attack.

part_3.name: Serene Grace
part_3.effect: Boosts the likelihood of added effects appearing.

part_3.name: Shadow Shield
part_3.effect: Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes while its HP is full.

part_3.name: Shadow Tag
part_3.effect: Prevents opposing Pokémon from fleeing.

part_3.name: Sharpness
part_3.effect: Powers up slicing moves.

part_3.name: Shed Skin
part_3.effect: The Pokémon may heal its own status conditions by shedding its skin.

part_3.name: Sheer Force
part_3.effect: Removes additional effects to increase the power of moves.

part_3.name: Shell Armor
part_3.effect: Protects the Pokémon from critical hits.

part_3.name: Shield Dust
part_3.effect: Blocks the added effects of attacks taken.

part_3.name: Shields Down
part_3.effect: When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokémon's shell breaks and it becomes aggressive.

part_3.name: Simple
part_3.effect: The Pokémon is prone to simple thinking and doubles its stat changes.

part_3.name: Skill Link
part_3.effect: Maximizes the number of times multi-strike moves hit.

part_3.name: Slow Start
part_3.effect: For five turns, the Pokémon's Attack and Speed stats are halved.

part_3.name: Slush Rush
part_3.effect: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a hailstorm.

part_3.name: Sniper
part_3.effect: Powers up moves if they become critical hits.

part_3.name: Snow Cloak
part_3.effect: Boosts evasiveness in a hailstorm.

part_3.name: Snow Warning
part_3.effect: The Pokémon summons a hailstorm when it enters a battle.

part_3.name: Solar Power
part_3.effect: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat in harsh sunlight, but HP decreases every turn.

part_3.name: Solid Rock
part_3.effect: Reduces the power of super-effective attacks taken.

part_3.name: Soul-Heart
part_3.effect: Boosts the Sp. Atk stat of the Pokémon when another Pokémon faints.

part_3.name: Soundproof
part_3.effect: Gives full immunity to all sound-based moves.

part_3.name: Speed Boost
part_3.effect: Its Speed stat is boosted every turn.

part_3.name: Stall
part_3.effect: The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.

part_3.name: Stamina
part_3.effect: Boosts the Defense stat when hit by an attack.

part_3.name: Stance Change
part_3.effect: The Pokémon changes its form to Blade Forme when it uses an attack move and changes to Shield Forme when it uses King's Shield.

part_3.name: Static
part_3.effect: Contact with the Pokémon may cause paralysis.

part_3.name: Steadfast
part_3.effect: Boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.

part_3.name: Steam Engine
part_3.effect: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat drastically when hit by a Fire- or Water-type move.

part_3.name: Steelworker
part_3.effect: Powers up Steel-type moves.

part_3.name: Steely Spirit
part_3.effect: Powers up the Steel-type moves of the Pokémon and its allies.

part_3.name: Stench
part_3.effect: By releasing a stench when attacking, this Pokémon may cause the target to flinch.

part_3.name: Sticky Hold
part_3.effect: Protects the Pokémon from item theft.

part_3.name: Storm Drain
part_3.effect: Draws in all Water-type moves to boost its own Sp. Atk stat.

part_3.name: Strong Jaw
part_3.effect: The Pokémon's strong jaw boosts the power of its biting moves.

part_3.name: Sturdy
part_3.effect: It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.

part_3.name: Suction Cups
part_3.effect: Negates moves that force switching out.

part_3.name: Super Luck
part_3.effect: Heightens the critical-hit ratios of moves.

part_3.name: Supreme Overlord
part_3.effect: When the Pokémon enters a battle, its Attack and Special Attack stats are slightly boosted for each of the allies in its party that have already been defeated.

part_3.name: Surge Surfer
part_3.effect: Doubles the Pokémon's Speed stat on Electric Terrain.

part_3.name: Swarm
part_3.effect: Powers up Bug-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

part_3.name: Sweet Veil
part_3.effect: Prevents the Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep.

part_3.name: Swift Swim
part_3.effect: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in rain.

part_3.name: Sword of Ruin
part_3.effect: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous sword lowers the Defense stats of all Pokémon except itself.

part_3.name: Symbiosis
part_3.effect: The Pokémon can pass an item to an ally.

part_3.name: Synchronize
part_3.effect: Passes on a burn, poison, or paralysis to the foe.

part_3.name: Tablets of Ruin
part_3.effect: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous tablets lowers the Attack stats of all Pokémon except itself.

part_3.name: Tangled Feet
part_3.effect: Raises evasiveness if the Pokémon is confused.

part_3.name: Tangling Hair
part_3.effect: Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.

part_3.name: Technician
part_3.effect: Powers up the Pokémon's weaker moves.

part_3.name: Telepathy
part_3.effect: Anticipates an ally's attack and dodges it.

part_3.name: Teravolt
part_3.effect: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

part_3.name: Thermal Exchange
part_3.effect: Boosts the Attack stat when the Pokémon is hit by a Fire-type move. The Pokémon also cannot be burned.

part_3.name: Thick Fat
part_3.effect: Ups resistance to Fire- and Ice-type moves.

part_3.name: Tinted Lens
part_3.effect: Powers up 'not very effective' moves.

part_3.name: Torrent
part_3.effect: Powers up Water-type moves when the Pokémon's HP is low.

part_3.name: Tough Claws
part_3.effect: Powers up moves that make direct contact.

part_3.name: Toxic Boost
part_3.effect: Powers up physical attacks when the Pokémon is poisoned.

part_3.name: Toxic Debris
part_3.effect: Scatters poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team when the Pokémon is hit by a physical move.

part_3.name: Trace
part_3.effect: The Pokémon copies a foe's Ability.

part_3.name: Transistor
part_3.effect: Powers up Electric-type moves.

part_3.name: Triage
part_3.effect: Gives priority to a healing move.

part_3.name: Truant
part_3.effect: The Pokémon can't use a move if it had one on the previous turn.

part_3.name: Turboblaze
part_3.effect: Moves can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

part_3.name: Unaware
part_3.effect: Ignores the opposing Pokémon's stat changes when attacking or being attacked.

part_3.name: Unburden
part_3.effect: Boosts the Speed stat if the Pokémon's held item is used or lost.

part_3.name: Unnerve
part_3.effect: Unnerves opposing Pokémon and makes them unable to eat Berries.

part_3.name: Unseen Fist
part_3.effect: If the Pokémon uses a move that makes direct contact, it can attack the target even if the target is using a move like Protect or Detect.

part_3.name: Vessel of Ruin
part_3.effect: The power of the Pokémon’s ruinous vessel lowers the Special Attack stats of all Pokémon except itself.

part_3.name: Victory Star
part_3.effect: Boosts the accuracy of its moves and its allies' moves.

part_3.name: Vital Spirit
part_3.effect: Prevents the Pokémon from falling asleep.

part_3.name: Volt Absorb
part_3.effect: Restores HP if hit by an Electric-type move, instead of taking damage.

part_3.name: Wandering Spirit
part_3.effect: The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon that hits it with a move that makes direct contact.

part_3.name: Water Absorb
part_3.effect: Restores HP if hit by a Water-type move, instead of taking damage.

part_3.name: Water Bubble
part_3.effect: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the Pokémon and prevents the Pokémon from being burned.

part_3.name: Water Compaction
part_3.effect: Boosts the Pokémon's Defense stat sharply when hit by a Water-type move.

part_3.name: Water Veil
part_3.effect: Prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

part_3.name: Weak Armor
part_3.effect: Physical attacks to the Pokémon lower its Defense stat but sharply raise its Speed stat.

part_3.name: Well-Baked Body
part_3.effect: The Pokémon takes no damage when hit by Fire-type moves. Instead, its Defense stat is sharply boosted.

part_3.name: White Smoke
part_3.effect: Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

part_3.name: Wimp Out
part_3.effect: The Pokémon cowardly switches out of battle when its HP drops below half.

part_3.name: Wind Power
part_3.effect: The Pokémon becomes charged when it is hit by a wind move, boosting the power of the next Electric-type move it uses.

part_3.name: Wind Rider
part_3.effect: Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat if Tailwind is in effect or if the Pokémon is hit by a wind move. The Pokémon also takes no damage from wind moves.

part_3.name: Wonder Guard
part_3.effect: Its mysterious power only lets super-effective moves hit the Pokémon.

part_3.name: Wonder Skin
part_3.effect: Makes status moves more likely to miss.

part_3.name: Zen Mode
part_3.effect: Changes the Pokémon's form when its HP drops to half or less.
